Energy-efficient air conditioning: An air conditioner that uses less energy and is more environmentally friendly, with features like a timer that automatically turns off the unit when not in use.
Self-cleaning air conditioning: An air conditioner that automatically cleans the air filters and coils, reducing the need for manual maintenance.
Voice-activated air conditioning: An air conditioner that can be controlled using voice commands, allowing users to adjust the temperature and settings without having to touch the unit.
Multi-zone air conditioning: An air conditioner that can be divided into multiple zones, allowing users to control the temperature in different areas of the house or office independently.
Air conditioning with air purification: An air conditioner that not only cools the air but also purifies it, removing allergens, pollutants, and other harmful particles.
